6af6351e-62b0-48f3-a2fc-1279e2f1cf0e.description: The holder of this badge understands the various ways universities organize and empower their units for professional, continuing, and online education. The earner can identify unique features and approaches within these entities, particularly in how they address the educational needs of adult learners. Further, the earner has a broad understanding of the variety of roles and models for professional, continuing, and online education across the academic landscape.
6af6351e-62b0-48f3-a2fc-1279e2f1cf0e.name: Overview of Professional, Continuing, and Online Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete PCO 103 in the Foundations Certificate program.

91610b22-9c9d-42cf-b991-d7466ec5abdb.description: The holder of this badge can define and identify markets within the scope of their institution. The earner can research a market in terms of quantity and quality as well as in terms of possible competition. The earner understands how to match market opportunities to program design. The earner understands the importance of surveying students and modifying marketing strategies and program design in response to feedback.
91610b22-9c9d-42cf-b991-d7466ec5abdb.name: Markets, Marketing, and Managing the Cycle from Prospects to Learners

badge_template_activities.title: Complete PCO 205  in the Professional Certificate program.

b38208cf-1e45-4993-8da0-4fc16f31e5a8.description: The holder of this badge has a foundational understanding of what makes higher education so important in the United States. The earner understands the past development of the American college and university, along with the realities, issues, and future prospects colleges and universities face. This earner appreciates the context and breadth of institutions beyond their personal and professional experience.
b38208cf-1e45-4993-8da0-4fc16f31e5a8.name: The Nature of American Higher Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete PCO 101 in the Foundations Certificate program.

ffebaf09-aac9-4b5a-b3a3-fa7df020a408.description: The holder of this badge has successfully demonstrated an understanding of the variety and differences among professional, continuing, and online education entities across the academic landscape. The earner can identify how PCO units are organized, who the stakeholders are and the range of responsibilities they have. The earner understands how to think strategically about how PCO enterprises leverage opportunities into programs by creating plans, developing consensus and launching initiatives.
ffebaf09-aac9-4b5a-b3a3-fa7df020a408.name: Academic Strategic Planning in a Constantly Changing Environment

badge_template_activities.title: Complete PCO 201  in the Professional Certificate program.

791dd8d5-a07c-4615-b04c-0defa6a2cd16.description: The earner of this badges has demonstrated an understanding of professional, continuing, and online education program planning. Earners have designed a program plan and have accounted for pricing, resource allocation, marketing, infrastructure, and faculty recruitment and support and how success is determined. Earners understand how a PCO professional can learn about how other universities operate and the role UPCEA plays in professional learning and networking.
791dd8d5-a07c-4615-b04c-0defa6a2cd16.name: Program Planning and Oversight in Professional, Continuing, and Online Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete PCO 105 in the Foundations Certificate program.

2fa5e343-2148-4ed5-88b0-67f5d8b34857.description: Network Leaders serve in a variety of roles for each of UPCEA’s five professional Networks. Network leaders work in collaboration with the UPCEA staff to execute the network’s annual work plan and develop activities and deliverables of specific interest to Network members.
2fa5e343-2148-4ed5-88b0-67f5d8b34857.name: UPCEA Network Leader 2021-2022

badge_template_activities.title: Attend monthly conference calls with the Network’s leadership team. Attend the Network’s yearly planning session and full membership meeting at the Annual Conference.

93a68908-7e16-4576-89f5-6491f493b1c8.description: The holder of this badge has demonstrated an ability to identify and promote an organizational model within the constraints and needs of their institution. The earner understands how professional, continuing, and online education leaders manage accross and up within their institutions to create strategic partnerships. The earner understands the qualities of effective leadership and can identify their own strenghts and weaknesses and how to complement their leadership style with others.
93a68908-7e16-4576-89f5-6491f493b1c8.name: Leading with Diplomacy, Data, and Drive: the Unique Imperative of the Professional, Continuing, and Online Leader

badge_template_activities.title: Complete PCO 301  in the Leader Certificate program.

78342a59-fba8-4563-9030-a2cb75b7e651.description: The holder of this badge has demonstrated understanding of how professional, continuing, and online education professionals analyze opportunities, project revenue and expenses, identify prudent ways to manage resources, monitor cash flow, and mitigate financial disaster. The earner understands how to measure success and respond to failure, reallocate resources, and determine new investment opportunities for their PCO enterprise.
78342a59-fba8-4563-9030-a2cb75b7e651.name: Forecasting, Budgeting, and Managing Money in an Environment of Uncertainty and Risk

badge_template_activities.title: Complete PCO 202  in the Professional Certificate program.

7bd13517-88f3-4b85-ba3f-5c8d8073c879.description: Association Leaders serve on special committees and may be appointed to various task forces and advisory groups by the board and UPCEA leadership. Volunteers leaders are selected for their commitment to the association and field of professional, continuing and online education, as well as for their experience and knowledge.
7bd13517-88f3-4b85-ba3f-5c8d8073c879.name: UPCEA Association Leader 2021-2022

badge_template_activities.title: Serve one year (continuous service) in an association-wide role.

777c12ed-7f2d-46a5-a59e-5d83994f7241.description: The holder of this badge has demonstrated an understanding of professional, continuing, and online education constituents and the demographics and profiles of adult learners and the need to accommodate the educational proclivities of adult learners in program design and delivery. The earner can engage those in corporations, professional associations, government agencies, and others in addressing the educational needs of unique populations, beyond traditional, college-age students.
777c12ed-7f2d-46a5-a59e-5d83994f7241.name: Understanding the Adult Learner and Other PCO Constituencies in Professional, Continuing, and Online Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete PCO 104 in the Foundations Certificate program.

cb733319-4a16-4575-b215-8bb15946ed2a.description: The holder of this badge has successfully demonstrated an understanding of the various structures of how professional, continuing, and online education units are staffed and organized. The earner understands how teams are assembled to design and launch new programs. The earner has successfuly identified and evaluated talent and understands how to maintain steady, high-performing operations. The earner understands the importance of staying abreast of new and innovative practices in PCO.
cb733319-4a16-4575-b215-8bb15946ed2a.name: Creating and Motivating PCO Enterprises

badge_template_activities.title: Complete PCO 203  in the Professional Certificate program.

abcbb548-e411-4285-b3d0-576f5944a733.description: The holder of this badge has successfully demonstrated an understanding of the importance of entreprenuership and innovation in the context of professional, continuing, and online education enterprises within the organizational context of a university The earner understands how individuals function as a team in a nimble organization. The earner can determine and mitigate risk and can evaluate programs and reform them when necessary.
abcbb548-e411-4285-b3d0-576f5944a733.name: The Entrepreneurial Imperative

badge_template_activities.title: Complete PCO 204  in the Professional Certificate program.

bc6c60e8-747b-4de2-b390-6067ca4cbc91.description: The holder of this badge has demonstrated an understanding of how professional, continuing, and online education leaders establish credibility as educators on campus and how academic initiatives are begun. The earner can convert ideas and needs into viable programs worthy of academic status and can design a curriculum that maintains academic integrity and rigor.
bc6c60e8-747b-4de2-b390-6067ca4cbc91.name: The Role of Educator: Expanding Academic Horizons

badge_template_activities.title: Complete PCO 302  in the Leader Certificate program.

fabaf0bb-9258-46f8-9743-fe5f30b1b5f7.description: The holder of this badge is an an aspiring academic administrator who can work and navigate within an academic enterprise. The earner understands the terminology, standards, roles, and structures that govern and guide the contemporary university.
fabaf0bb-9258-46f8-9743-fe5f30b1b5f7.name: The Language and Culture of Higher Learning

badge_template_activities.title: Complete PCO 102 in the Foundations Certificate program.

03bfcb77-42e1-4ec5-a396-149aafb2b9dd.description: The holder of this badge has successfully completed UPCEA's PCO Professional Certificate program. Earners have completed five four-week PCO Professional courses and demonstrated knowledge and understanding of skills and topics vital to a successful PCO professional as outlined in UPCEA's Competency and Attribute Statements for Professional, Continuing, and Online Education professionals.
03bfcb77-42e1-4ec5-a396-149aafb2b9dd.name: PCO Professional Certificate

alignments.name: Competency and Attribute Statements for Professional, Continuing, and Online Practitioners
alignments.description: The Competency and Attribute Statements for Professional, Continuing, and Online Practitioners consist of the essential knowledge, skills, and dispositions required of Professional, Continuing, and Online (PCO) Education practitioners.

badge_template_activities.title: To earn the PCO Professional Certificate, learners must complete five four-week PCO Professional Courses from UPCEA's catalog of Online Professional Development courses.

80810a6c-355a-49dc-86a8-e061697fc7fb.description: The holder of this badge has demonstrated an ability to repesent their institution exteranally across a number of sectors. The earner of this badge is a leader who understands the importance of building bridges between the institution and its external communitites. The earner can build connections and relationships based on common interests that can be leveraged into collaboration on joint initiatives. The earner understands the negotiation and diplomacy skills that are vital to these efforts.
80810a6c-355a-49dc-86a8-e061697fc7fb.name: The Role of Ambassador: Connecting Academic and Real Worlds by Engaging Those in Business, Community, and Government

badge_template_activities.title: Complete PCO 303  in the Leader Certificate program.

ddfc9af5-6233-44b2-9f0a-94a39fa6c0b7.description: The holder of this badge has demonstrated an understanding of the ethical challenges and dillemas that professional, continuing, and online education leaders face and how those challenges should be approached and addressed. The earner can evaluate the quality of a program and take important steps toward improvements. The earner understands how a leader can personify integrity and establish unit-wide values that exemplify the ethical standards of their institutions.
ddfc9af5-6233-44b2-9f0a-94a39fa6c0b7.name: The Responsible Professional: Managing Through Transparency, Integrity, Quality, and Accountability

badge_template_activities.title: Complete PCO 305 in the Leader Certificate program.

af0f63fb-bf75-4b01-a2f3-2a81eb2285f8.description: The holder of this badge understands the unique imperative of professional, continuing, and online education leaders in helping their institution be more agile, innovative, and responsive. The earner has demonstrated the expertise needed to work with external stakeholders to design and execute strategies. The earner can communicate their vision and values to others and can assess, balance, and combine academic and business goals.
af0f63fb-bf75-4b01-a2f3-2a81eb2285f8.name: The Role of Innovator: Managing An Adaptive, Agile Organization

badge_template_activities.title: Complete PCO 304  in the Leader Certificate program.

af93b4f4-98b7-4a03-a411-36c9670f78b1.description: UPCEA Regional Leaders work in conjunction with the UPCEA staff to provide opportunities for members to examine issues of local and regional importance, to develop collaborative initiatives, to assist in membership engagement and recruitment, and to network with area colleagues. Regional leaders work with UPCEA staff to plan and shape the region’s annual conference, serving in various capacities. Screen reader support enabled.
af93b4f4-98b7-4a03-a411-36c9670f78b1.name: UPCEA Regional Leader 2021-2022

badge_template_activities.title: Serve for 1 year on a regional council and/or planning committee

c768f962-24a1-448f-862a-a7c7c9a40a04.description: The holder of this badge has successfully completed UPCEA's PCO Leader Certificate program. Earners have completed five four-week PCO Leader courses and demonstrated knowledge and understanding of skills and topics vital to a successful professional, continuing, and online education leader as outlined in UPCEA's Competency and Attribute Statements for Professional, Continuing, and Online Education professionals.
c768f962-24a1-448f-862a-a7c7c9a40a04.name: PCO Leader Certificate

alignments.name: Competency and Attribute Statements for Professional, Continuing, and Online Practitioners
alignments.description: The Competency and Attribute Statements for Professional, Continuing, and Online Practitioners consist of the essential knowledge, skills, and dispositions required of Professional, Continuing, and Online (PCO) Education practitioners.

badge_template_activities.title: To earn the PCO Leader Certificate, learners must complete five four-week PCO Leader Courses from UPCEA's catalog of Online Professional Development courses.

skills.name: Apply Concepts Of Diversity And Inclusion

41a9a480-100c-40ae-80ac-e470a005b4da.description: Awarded to participants who engage in a pre-conference workshop, pre-selected concurrent sessions, curated networking opportunities with peers and senior leaders, and a reflective capstone session designed to develop critical skills needed for leadership such as strategic planning, goal setting, communication skills and emotional intelligence, project management and leading with information, conflict management, motivating and leading teams, and budget development and organizational structures.
41a9a480-100c-40ae-80ac-e470a005b4da.name: PCO Emerging Leader 2019

badge_template_activities.title: Earners engage in a comprehensive self-reflection, which assesses, formally, the ways in which they have experienced the twin pillars of the program: leadership and skill development.

abbddea0-937e-4010-9dfb-e6b4aba54353.description: The UPCEA Board of Directors directs the affairs of the Association, determines its policies, and advances its goals, except as otherwise provided in the Association's Bylaws. The Board meets three times each year in January, April, and June. Board members are nominated and elected by UPCEA member institutional representatives, and each year, three at-large members are appointed.
abbddea0-937e-4010-9dfb-e6b4aba54353.name: UPCEA Board of Directors 2021-2022

badge_template_activities.title: Serve as a member of the Board of Directors and perform duties toward the governance of the Association.
Meet in person three times annually and serve on subcommittees, task forces or for other related assignments during their tenure.

96ebaad5-5f76-4b30-91f1-7b98895bd096.description: Awarded to institutions that are exemplars of online learning enterprises in postsecondary education. Recognized institutions have been evaluated to have optimized or managed status levels in all seven of the UPCEA Hallmarks for Excellence in Online Leadership (Internal Advocacy, Entrepreneurial Initiative, Faculty Support, Student Support, Digital Technology, External Advocacy, and Professionalism and across seven parameters for each Hallmark.
96ebaad5-5f76-4b30-91f1-7b98895bd096.name: Hallmarks of Excellence in Online Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: Organization must pass a comprehensive Hallmark review that requires institutional leaders to submit evidence related to all aspects of online education.

0f0b8724-a25c-405c-8aea-b641b16295f5.description: UPCEA Regional Leaders work in conjunction with the UPCEA staff to provide opportunities for members to examine issues of local and regional importance, to develop collaborative initiatives, to assist in membership engagement and recruitment, and to network with area colleagues. Regional leaders work with UPCEA staff to plan and shape the region’s annual conference, serving in various capacities. Screen reader support enabled.
0f0b8724-a25c-405c-8aea-b641b16295f5.name: UPCEA Regional Leader 2020-2021

badge_template_activities.title: Serve for 1 year on a regional council and/or planning committee

52f6bd04-f986-4d32-a268-286f6dbd7c48.description: NCOE Advisory board members serve on board subcommittees focused on innovation in teaching and learning, quality assurance, events and engagement, and professional development. NCOE advisory board members are well-established in the field of postsecondary online learning and are employed at institutions known for innovation in digital learning.
52f6bd04-f986-4d32-a268-286f6dbd7c48.name: NCOE Advisory Board 2019-2020

badge_template_activities.title: Complete at least one year of continuous service on the National Council for Online Education (NCOE) Advisory Board.

c3dec6be-a963-4cbc-9e61-2eac35ab7118.description: Association Leaders serve on special committees and may be appointed to various task forces and advisory groups by the board and UPCEA leadership. Volunteers leaders are selected for their commitment to the association and field of professional, continuing and online education, as well as for their experience and knowledge.
c3dec6be-a963-4cbc-9e61-2eac35ab7118.name: UPCEA Association Leader 2018-2019

badge_template_activities.title: Serve one year (continuous service) in an association-wide role.
